This module contains all classed used for the first stage of preprocessing.

class GroupManager(input_manager, countries_pp)[source]

Bases: object

The group manager is responsible for pre-processing the coefficients for all country groups and providing the results. These can be obtained via calling the provided methods.

Variables:

  • separate_countries_group (dict[str, set[str]]) – The countries calculated separately for each product. Is of the form {front_label -> [separate countries]}.

  • joined_groups (dict[str, [CountryGroupJoinedDiversified]]) – The dictionary containing all joined groups for a product. Is of form {front_label -> [grp1, grp2, …]}

  • joined_groups – The dictionary containing all joined_diversified groups for a product. Is of form {front_label -> [grp1, grp2, …]}

  • country_to_group_map (dict[str, dict[str, (GroupType, int)]]) – A dictionary that for each product maps a country name to its group_id and group_type. Is of form {front_label -> back_label -> (group_type, group_id)}

Parameters:

countries_pp (dict[str, endemo2.preprocessing.preprocessing_step_one.CountryPreprocessed]) –

get_coef_for_country_and_product(country_name, product_name)[source]

Get the calculated group coefficient for a certain country and a certain product.

Parameters:

  • country_name – The name of the country.

  • product_name – The name of the product.

Return type:

Coef

Returns:

The group-calculated coefficients.

is_in_separate_group(country_name, product_name)[source]

Return whether country should be calculated separately or is member of a group and should therefore use the group coefficients.

Parameters:

  • country_name – The name of the country.

  • product_name – The name of the product.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

The bool indicating whether the country is not in a country group for the given product.

class CtsPreprocessed(country_name, general_input, cts_input, pop_his, pop_nuts2_his)[source]

Bases: object

Preprocesses everything of the cts sector.

Variables:

  • specific_consumption (dict[DemandType, Timeseries]) – The specific consumption timeseries for each demand type of form {demand_type -> timeseries}.

  • employee_share_in_subsector_country (dict[str, Timeseries]) – The timeseries of the share of the population that is an employee in a certain subsector. Is of form {country_name -> timeseries}

  • employee_share_in_subsector_nuts2 (dict[str, dict[str, Timeseries]]) – The timeseries of the share of the population of a nuts2 region that is an employee in a certain subsector. Is of form {country_name -> {region_name -> timeseries}}

  • general_input (GeneralInput) –

class ProductPreprocessed(country_name, product_input, population_historical, gdp_historical, general_input)[source]

Bases: object

The preprocessed product information for a given country.

Variables:

  • amount_vs_year (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount. The x-axis is time in years.

  • amount_vs_gdp (TwoDseries) – Used to predict the product amount. The x-axis is the countries_in_group’ gdp.

  • amount_per_capita_vs_year (Timeseries) – Used to predict the product amount per capita. The x-axis is time in years.

  • amount_per_capita_vs_gdp (TwoDseries) – Used to predict the product amount per capita. The x-axis is time in years.

  • specific_consumption_pp (SpecificConsumptionPreprocessed) – The preprocessed specific consumption data.

  • _nuts2_installed_capacity (dict[str, float]) – The installed capacity for this product in each NUTS2 region for the country this product belongs to.

Parameters:

  • country_name (str) –

  • product_input (ProductInput) –

  • population_historical (Timeseries) –

  • gdp_historical (Timeseries) –

  • general_input (GeneralInput) –

class SpecificConsumptionPreprocessed(country_name, product_input, general_input, quantity_per_year)[source]

Bases: object

The preprocessed specific consumption for a given product.

Variables:

  • default_specific_consumption (SpecConsum) – The specific consumption for a product type, that is used as default if there is no historical data to predict the specific consumption.

  • specific_consumption_historical (dict[DemandType, Timeseries]) – The dictionary holding the timeseries for each demand type’s historical demand.

  • historical_sc_available (bool) – Indicates whether there is any historical data for the given product in the given country.

  • bat (EH) – The specific consumption of the best available technology.

Parameters:

  • country_name (str) –

  • product_input (ProductInput) –

  • general_input (GeneralInput) –

  • quantity_per_year (Timeseries) –

endemo2.preprocessing.preprocessing_utility module

energy_carrier_to_energy_consumption(efficiency, dict_ec_his)[source]

Convert the energy carriers to electricity and heat with efficiency and sum them up.

Parameters:

  • efficiency (dict[str, EH]) – The efficiency of each energy carrier of the form {energy_carrier_name -> efficiency_tuple}

  • dict_ec_his (dict[str, [<class ‘endemo2.data_structures.containers.Datapoint’>]]) – The energy carrier consumption of form {energy_carrier_name -> consumption_amount_data}

Return type:

(Timeseries, Timeseries)

Returns:

sum of energy consumption and sum of heat consumption. Of form (energy_consumption_sum, heat_consumption_sum)

endemo2.preprocessing.preprocessor module

This module contains all things shared by the different preprocessing stages.
